results.title: Evaluation of two highly effective lipid-lowering therapies in subjects with acute myocardial infarction
results.text_hl: Twenty @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@STEMI@@@ were randomized to be treated with @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ 20 mg QD or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg combined with @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ 10 mg QD for 30 days.

citations.NLM: Klassen A, Faccio AT, Picossi CRC, Derogis PBMC, Dos Santos Ferreira CE, Lopes AS, Sussulini A, Cruz ECS, Bastos RT, Fontoura SC, Neto AMF, Tavares MFM, Izar MC, Fonseca FAH. Evaluation of two highly effective lipid-lowering therapies in subjects with acute myocardial infarction Sci Rep. 2021 Aug 5;11(1):15973. PMID: 34354179
citations.BibTeX: @article{34354179, title={Evaluation of two highly effective lipid-lowering therapies in subjects with acute myocardial infarction}, author={Klassen A and Faccio AT and Picossi CRC and Derogis PBMC and Dos Santos Ferreira CE and Lopes AS and Sussulini A and Cruz ECS and Bastos RT and Fontoura SC and Neto AMF and Tavares MFM and Izar MC and Fonseca FAH}, journal={Sci Rep}, volume={11}, number={1}, pages={15973}}

results.title: Prior simvastatin treatment is associated with reduced thrombin generation and platelet activation in patients with acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: METHODS: We studied 53 consecutive @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@STEMI@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ admitted within 12 hours of @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ onset, including 19 treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg/d) (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group) at least one month prior to @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@STEMI@@@, and 34 not receiving any statins (no-statin group) on admission.

citations.NLM: Pastuszczak M, Kotlarz A, Mostowik M, Zalewski J, Zmudka K, Undas A. Prior simvastatin treatment is associated with reduced thrombin generation and platelet activation in patients with acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction. Thromb Res. 2010 May;125(5):382-6. PMID: 19631970
citations.BibTeX: @article{19631970, title={Prior simvastatin treatment is associated with reduced thrombin generation and platelet activation in patients with acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.}, author={Pastuszczak M and Kotlarz A and Mostowik M and Zalewski J and Zmudka K and Undas A}, journal={Thromb Res}, volume={125}, number={5}, pages={382-6}}

results.title: [Rosuvastatin improves myocardial function and arteriosclerosis plaque in patients with ST-segment elevation after acute myocardial infarction and percutaneous coronary intervention].
results.journal: Nan Fang Yi Ke Da Xue Xue Bao
results.text_hl: METHODS: Sixty-five @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@STEMI@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were randomized to receive 40 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (n=32) or 10 mg @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ (n=33) before sleep in addition to conventional medications.

citations.NLM: Lin ZP, Shu PC, Liao ZJ, Wang XQ, Liu Q. [Rosuvastatin improves myocardial function and arteriosclerosis plaque in patients with ST-segment elevation after acute myocardial infarction and percutaneous coronary intervention]. Nan Fang Yi Ke Da Xue Xue Bao. 2011 Oct;31(10):1789-91. PMID: 22027793
citations.BibTeX: @article{22027793, title={[Rosuvastatin improves myocardial function and arteriosclerosis plaque in patients with ST-segment elevation after acute myocardial infarction and percutaneous coronary intervention].}, author={Lin ZP and Shu PC and Liao ZJ and Wang XQ and Liu Q}, journal={Nan Fang Yi Ke Da Xue Xue Bao}, volume={31}, number={10}, pages={1789-91}}

results.title: [Effects of different statins, ezetimibe/simvastatin combination on hsCRP levels in unstable angina pectoris and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction patients: a randomized trial].
results.text_hl: [Effects of different statins, @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ combination on hsCRP levels in @DISEASE_Angina_Unstable @DISEASE_MESH:D000789 @@@unstable angina pectoris@@@ and non-@<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@ elevation @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@: a randomized trial].

citations.NLM: Namal E, Sener N, Ulaş T, Akçalı Z, Oztekin E, Borlu F. [Effects of different statins, ezetimibe/simvastatin combination on hsCRP levels in unstable angina pectoris and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction patients: a randomized trial]. Anadolu Kardiyol Derg. 2011 Dec;11(8):703-10. PMID: 22088858

results.title: Achievement of LDL-cholesterol goal with statins after an st segment elevation myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: At follow-up, target LDL-C < 70 mg/dL or LDL-C reduction >= 50% was achieved in 30.1% (n = 65) of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, 27.4% (n = 43) on @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and 37.3% (n = 22) on other statins, (p = 0.158, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ versus other statins).

citations.NLM: Tungsubutra W, Phongtuntakul B. Achievement of LDL-cholesterol goal with statins after an st segment elevation myocardial infarction. J Med Assoc Thai. 2015 Feb;98(2):129-36. PMID: 25842792
citations.BibTeX: @article{25842792, title={Achievement of LDL-cholesterol goal with statins after an st segment elevation myocardial infarction.}, author={Tungsubutra W and Phongtuntakul B}, journal={J Med Assoc Thai}, volume={98}, number={2}, pages={129-36}}
